Description:
IMMACULATE TOWNHOUSE ON HISTORIC GROUNDS
This stunning property is located at the quiet end of a row of stylishly built beautiful townhouses, created to sit alongside the old St Aidan’s Orphanage and the grounds surrounding. Perfectly situated in easy walking distance from Strath Village, Strath Hill and Kennington Reservoir, this contemporary home is close to all amenities.
Enter through a beautifully landscaped courtyard and past the deck at the front of the home, offering views across the immaculately maintained grounds. As part of the Body Corporate, the owner would benefit from the gardens being cared for by professionals.
Walking into the home and through the entry hall, you are welcomed into the large lounge and dining space. Beautiful views from the vast picture window include the gardens and the city beyond.
An extended pantry and euro laundry is tucked neatly away in cabinetry across from kitchen and the modern kitchen enjoys granite overlay benchtops and high-end Bosch appliances including a dishwasher, gas cooktop, electric oven. Ample storage throughout the kitchen includes a neat rollaway benchtop cupboard for additional appliances.
Heading through to the rear of the house is a powder room and then a formal lounge. From the lounge, sliding plantation shutters and glass sliding doors open wide out to the rear deck and neat landscaped courtyard. Beautiful lemon trees neatly surround the artificial turf, and large slate paving lead to the timber feature wall that neatly hides access to the double garage.
The garage, with its roller door opening from the driveway at the rear, has additional storage and a clothesline.
Back indoors, from the front entrance, carpeted stairs lead you to the second storey. A skylight above the stairwell, and in the family bathroom, provides additional light and a landing at the top of the stairs serves as a small library.
Two good-sized bedrooms, both with built-in robes, look out over the back courtyard and the family bathroom is next to the separate toilet.
Finally, explore the luxurious master suite. Glass sliding doors lead out to a balcony, providing plenty of light and beautiful sunrise views over the city. A large walk-in robe with ample practical shelving and hanging space is next to the light and bright generously-sized ensuite, providing a beautiful outlook of the estate and beyond from the cathedral window.
This lovely modern home provides all the features you could require, including downlights and refrigerative ducted heating and cooling, and a stylish neutral décor allowing you to make it your own.
Feel secure and at home as a part of this high-end estate in a beautiful townhouse providing a low-maintenance, relaxing lifestyle.
Insights: 12/190 St Aidans Road, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Terrific Investment - Currently Returning $400 per week!
This delightful, single-fronted Victorian home aches with history and for professional couples, investors or down-sizers - is possibly in the best location ever. Located literally just minutes from the heart of the city. Stroll to Kennington Village, close to local schools and cafes, Bendigo Train Station, hospital/university precincts and the wide open spaces of Kennington Reservoir and Beischer Street walking tracks. Investors will be pleased with the fantastic $400 per week returns!
The home boasts the street appeal of the period, impressive entrance hall, three excellent bedrooms (high ceilings), separate living area (original floorboards), separate kitchen, separate tiled bathroom, laundry, toilet, and decked entertaining space.
As you enter through the restored picket fence and gate you are greeted by the rolling green grass and cottage garden that has the perfect hardwood deck to sit and watch the world go by. With the new driveway finished in exposed aggregate concrete and the gable roof garage oozing charm you can simply lock your car away and enjoy all the hard work that has been completed. All the paths to the back yard are finished in exposed aggregate concrete with the low maintenance backyard offering the entertainer a fantastic surprise.
French doors lead from the dining area onto magnificent hard wood deck under roof alfresco area that has the added bonus of a servery from the kitchen and ceiling fan. With so much work complete and in such a fantastic location, this home is sure to be popular.
Insights: 76 Condon Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
QUALITY & COMFORT IN SORT AFTER LOCATION
This quality Paul Gray built townhouse in an idyllic central location offers modern, low maintenance living that is perfect for investors, downsizers or even the first home buyer. This beautiful brick vernier home is less than a year old and presents itself as new.
The property consists of 2 Bedrooms (one with direct access to the bathroom) both with spacious built in robes and split systems for heating and cooling, a 3-piece bathroom including shower and bath, separate toilet, European laundry and a wonderful open plan living design. The kitchen includes a stove, oven and dishwasher.
With all the fixtures and fittings you’d expect in a modern townhouse including an electronic garage, concreted outdoor area and low maintenance landscaped gardens this property certainly offers a high-quality lifestyle without compromise.
Key Features:
· Split System heating & cooling in 2 bedrooms and lounge area
· Low maintenance garden
· Functional open plan living
· 3 piece bathroom
· Amazing location close to schools, shops and Bendigo CBD

Description:
Substantial Offering in Blue Chip Position with 3 Residences
Extremely impressive and incomparable in its uniqueness, is this architecturally designed property, situated in one of the most exclusive areas in popular Kennington.
-Outstanding residential or investment flexibility is on offer with 51, 51A and 51B Mill Street, being offered to the market as a whole on one Title - measuring 1294m2 in land size.
-Spacious and well-designed brick veneer residence comprises 4 bedrooms, study, 2 bathrooms, kitchen/meals, large lounge and beautiful in-ground pool.
-There are two one bedroom, fully furnished studio apartments that each comprise a living room, bedroom, kitchen and bathroom facilities.
-The property has a history of returning $1030 (approx 7.5% return) per week in total.
-Imagine living in this blue chip position, utilising the residence as a home and achieving up to $600 per week (combined) for the two studio apartments.
Alternatively it's a perfect option to utilise the studios as accommodation for teenagers or elderly family members.
The property has only exchanged hands once in the past, so a rare opportunity presents itself to become only the third owners of this adaptable residence, which provides a lifestyle that's reminiscent of living in a holiday house permanently.
Insights: 51 Mill Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018.

Description:
Classic California Bungalow
Positioned in a blue chip location on the fringe of the Bendigo CBD you will find this lovingly restored 'California Bungalow'.
Within walking distance to the Bendigo Market Place, Bendigo Train Station and Ewing Park Recreation Reserve this home has so much to offer:
* Four spacious bedrooms, master with ensuite
* Open plan kitchen, meals and living space with vinyl plank flooring.
* Stunning kitchen with quality cabinetry, 900mm oven and gas cook top, butlers pantry and island bench with timber bench top.
* Split system heating and cooling unit.
* Central bathroom with timber vanity unit, gold tap fittings, free standing claw bath and corner shower
* Quality period fittings and fixtures throughout the entire home
Outside you will discover a large undercover entertainers deck, shed with automatic door, all positioned on a great sized block.

Description:
3 Bedroom Bargain
Freshly painted with new carpets, this low maintenance, 3 bedroom property on a level (approx.) 502m2, is the perfect start for any first home buyer, investor looking for a positive return, or a lovely “downsizer” for the retiree.
The home includes refrigerated air conditioning, evaporative cooling and ceiling fans.
Built-in robes in all bedrooms, practical kitchen area with ample cupboards and generous bench space, plus adjacent dining with outdoor access.
Bathroom, separate toilet and laundry.
A great 4.8m x 6.2m shed at the rear of the property has a small work shop space and roller door for car parking.
Sensor lighting and paved driveways allow a secured off street parking area for your vehicle. Such a great opportunity to get into the market, this solid home is well located close to public transport, St. Theresa's Primary and parkland.
It needs to be on your shopping list!
Insights: 9 Owen Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
RED BRICK RENOVATOR!
Budget conscious buyers and renovators rejoice!!! A fantastic opportunity presents without the hefty price tag in this affordable red brick home situated in a highly sought after area ready for the savvy buyer to pounce! Only 10 minutes walk to the Bendigo CBD and surrounded by amenities including shops, supermarket, schools, transport and sporting facilities, the idyllic location to suit both owner occupiers and investors alike.
Presented in original order throughout, the property is liveable or rentable for the time being whilst you decide what to do. Renovators will be barely be able to contain their eagerness to get started on a project that should see them reap the benefits in the near future. The homes internal layout consists of three carpeted bedrooms with ceiling fans providing accommodation, utility room/office at the rear, and a serviceable bathroom and separate toilet central to them all. A cosy lounge sits off the central hallway and is equipped with gas heater and ceiling fan, whilst the functional kitchen is original but in working order for now until it's time to update. The laundry at the rear completes the internal layout.
Outside is a good sized 643m2 (approx.) allotment that is a blank canvas to grow your surrounds. A fully fenced yard makes it child and pet friendly. There is plenty of off street parking, and a large shed with concrete floor that double as undercover car storage, whilst there is loads of room for a fabulous outdoor entertaining area.
Conveniently located, life becomes so much easier with everything at your doorstep. Great for the budget conscious occupier, its an affordable renovator or cheap first home in a good area to break the rental cycle. Or for the investor looking for a solid addition to your investment portfolio, the location and price tag will only mean your investment will grow over time!
Insights: 9 Thompson Crescent, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Superb Investment Opportunity - Over 6% Return!
On offer for astute investors is 5 x 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom units in an excellent location.
Located in Kennington, this 1,239sqm block of units is only a short walk to Strath Village Shopping Centre and a 5-minute drive from Bendigo CBD and La Trobe University.
Students could actually walk to classes if they wanted to.
Being sold as a whole, each unit is on its own separate title, there is no active body corporate either.
All units are currently leased and bring in an income of approximately $68,000 p.a.
That's an excellent return of over 6%!
Maintained very well by the current owner;
- Each unit has been painted recently
- Some have new carpet
- Some have new vanity's in their bathrooms
- Hot water units are new
Other features include;
- Each of the 2 bedrooms has built in robes
- Gas cooking
- Gas heating and split system cooling
- Each unit has its own single carport
- Each unit has its own private court yard at the rear
A section 32 is available and private inspections can be arranged.
Enquire now to secure an outstanding investment opportunity before it's too late.

Description:
Modern and spacious all in one
Residing on a popular street in the bustling town of Strathdale, sits this freshly renovated 4 bedroom home. Close to the Kennington Reservoir, Strath Village, Apco and McIvor Road park, this modern and spacious home would be suited for families, executive couples, investors or those wanting an upgrade.
Inside, the home has been freshly painted and has had new carpet put in and has downlights throughout, bringing a stylish feel to the property. The open plan living area is spacious and provides owners a place to relax and entertain guests. The kitchen is a perfect spot for the upcoming masterchefs to prepare the meals with the brand new dishwasher, double sink, plenty of bench and cupboard space and a kitchen island.
The master bedroom is large and is complete with an ensuite and WIR. Bedrooms 2, 3 and 4 are also of generous size and feature built in robes. Inside the family bathroom is a large shower, spa bath and vanity and the laundry is complete with plenty of bench and cupboard space, sink and rear access. Adding to the already long list of features, a brand new hot water service has just been installed and the home features a fitted ducted vacuum system.
A feature of this home is the separate living room that would be perfect for a rumpus room, theatre room or a formal living area.
Outside is a great benefit of the home. There is a large entertaining area with beautiful trees and plants surrounding and a grass area perfect for the kids to play on.
The home is complete with ducted heating and Daiken reverse cycle inverter ducted air conditioner with phone access, secure fencing and a double car auto door garage with rear roller door access. Throughout the home, black interior blinds are fitted along with outside to shade the sun.
If a modern and stylish home ready to be lived in, is what you're hunting for then look no further than this beauty!

Description:
Executive Living Overlooking the Kennington Reservoir!
The sought-after location of this stunning family home is truly what sets it apart, offering elevated views across the Kennington Reservoir from the private balcony. Set only seconds from the Kennington Village shopping complex, Kennington Primary School (virtually next door), Edwards Providore, Aldi, specialty stores, the La Trobe University and sporting facilities. This home is a must to inspect.
Comprising of three large and open plan living spaces there will be more than enough room to entertain family & friends. The well-appointed timber kitchen is fitted with a stainless steel Bosch stove & oven, a dishwasher, an abundance of cupboard space, a breakfast bar and a large pantry. The tiled meals area overlooks the kitchen and rear yard. Heating and cooling is taken care of throughout, with ducted gas heating upstairs & downstairs and reverse cycle cooling downstairs.
The main bedroom is located downstairs and offers a walk-in robe and ensuite. There is a separate toilet with access to the laundry. The remaining three bedrooms are each located upstairs, offering built in robes for storage. The family bathroom upstairs includes a bath, shower and separate toilet. There is also under staircase storage for added convenience - you won't be short on space!
There is a double lock up garage, plus off street parking available allowing space for at least another four vehicles due to the second drive way. Also, a terracotta tiled roof and a small orchard area at the top of the yard - approximately 120 square metres in size, with a fig, a cherry, a lemon, two peach, an apricot tree and a loquat tree with a garden shed.
This immaculate home has much to offer, set at the end of a quiet court you will not be disappointed by the lifestyle options available in this desirable location. Positioned on a generous 1142sqm block presenting an array of opportunities for additional out buildings, shedding, a pool and even for subdivision potential (STCA). This is one you don't want to miss out on. Contact the agent to arrange your viewing of this sensational home today.

Description:
Vendor Relocated Make an Offer
Full of character & charm on a large double sized allotment. Perfect for a family, the home features a spacious central living and dining area serviced by a stylish modern kitchen with an adjoining undercover deck ideal for all year round entertaining. A separate formal lounge adds appeal. All three bedrooms are robed, the huge master boasting a large walk-in robe and ensuite. The beautiful large allotment is the showpiece here ideal for the family to add their own touches. Additional features include gas heating and air conditioning, storage shed. Located in a quiet area, this exceptional home is convenient to countless parks, local Primary and Secondary schools, Kennington Village, Strath Hill, Strath Village, Kennington Reservoir and so much more. Take advantage of a rare opportunity to acquire a fabulous family home on such huge block, in a perfect location.

Description:
All the Renovation Work Completed and it's right in the heart of Kennington!
Located just off Condon Street & a short walk to Strath Village, Kennington Village, Strath Hill, La Trobe Uni and schools, is this outstanding residence. All the renovation work has been done for you. The main bedroom now has a brand new ensuite and WIR. 2nd and 3rd bedroom with BIR's and 4 piece bathroom and laundry. Polished floorboards, comfortable lounge, separate revamped dining room or 2nd living area. Magnificent kitchen with heaps of storage and easy access drawers, double wall oven and split system. Ducted floor heating, evaporative cooling and freshly painted throughout. Outside provides a 10 x 8 metre shed with concrete floor & power, double remote doors, ideal for a home base tradie or home handyman, plus a double carport. A fabulous ground deck entertainment area is a feature of the backyard. Do yourself a favour, this one is ripe for the picking....move in and enjoy, all the work has been done!

Description:
DELIGHTFUL OASIS IN KENNINGTON
Located in popular Kennington and walking distance to schools, shops, pubs, sporting and recreational reserves, Strath Village and Bendigo’s CBD is this beautifully presented property.
Positioned neatly on a wide allotment, the solid brick, mid-century style home has an immaculate front yard providing plenty of curb appeal. The established, low-maintenance garden provides secure access to the rear of the property of both sides of the house.
Under the house is a single garage and workshop, with off-street parking available for an additional vehicle.
Head up stairs, above the garage, to the entry and find a large tiled patio with views towards East Bendigo – the perfect place to sit with your morning coffee and watch the sun rise.
Through the front door is a large formal entry that makes use of original features such as timber flooring and decorative cornice.
To the right of the entry is a large master bedroom, with a built-in robe that provides additional storage above the main cupboard, an air conditioner and ceiling fan.
To the left, is a light and bright living room that provides an open plan design to access the dining room at the front of the property and kitchen at the rear. This light and bright space includes windows across three sides and French doors from the living room open out on to the front patio. A split system offers cooling and heating to the area, and ducted heating can also be found throughout the property.
The contemporary kitchen enjoys plenty of cupboard space, including a walk-in pantry and central island bench. With room for a double fridge along with a dishwasher, four-burner gas cooktop and electric oven, all modern conveniences have been considered.
From the kitchen is a small hallway leading back to the main hall. Off this is a linen closet and a laundry, which also features a toilet tucked away behind a private wall.
Off the main hallway is a light-filled family bathroom and two good-sized bedrooms, one with a ceiling fan, air conditioner and built-in robe, complete the layout.
The kitchen opens out to the backyard and a spacious undercover deck, complete with ceiling fan and merbau bench seating. This relaxing area overlooks the inground pool and a large palm tree – the perfect little oasis. To each side of the pool is a good-sized lawn area and established planting, each leading to the secure gates that open to the front yard.
This fantastic home is neat as a pin and, with nothing to do except move in and enjoy, its fantastic location ensures this is a property with plenty to offer.

Description:
LIVE IN COMFORT INSIDE OR OUTSIDE – ALL YEAR ROUND
A brilliant Kennington find you can't fault the outstanding location, tucked away in a private and peaceful pocket. Such a beautiful transformation has taken place throughout this home with all the hard work taken care of both inside and out. Fresh and radiant offering a very private and secure entryway, the home has a lovely flow and the interior design has been tastefully selected. The fully equipped kitchen has been beautifully remodelled showcasing loads of drawers, large oven and island bench which doubles as a breakfast bar, all of which is seamlessly blended with the relaxed meals area for a very inclusive open plan family space. Step down to the spacious lounge adjacent, and for those after additional space, conveniently the nearby alfresco deck and sunny terrace offers sheltered, all-weather living with handy mains gas BBQ and plenty of space to entertain or relax and soak up the Aussie outdoors year-round. 3 good sized bedrooms, including master with contemporary ensuite, large shower plus walk-in robe full of practical storage space. Handy central study nook perfect for the kids, remodelled bathroom, large laundry with built-in cabinetry finished off with a separate toilet. This astonishing makeover includes plantation shutters and ceiling fans throughout, striking flooring, ducted floor heating and evaporative cooling. Outdoors, the secure fencing and lush lawn make the backyard a safe and happy haven for children and pets, while the double lock-up garage includes plenty of workshop space; in addition there's an easily accessible carport that fits a caravan underneath. Attractive low maintenance gardens both back and front present enormous appeal, as does the closeness to a selection of schools, easy stroll to shops and all todays' modern family conveniences. Warm and homely, this spacious well-presented home not only screams location, it also offers a rare opportunity to simply move in and enjoy with absolutely nothing to do!
Insights: 21 Hewitt Avenue, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2018 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.
